utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I just I've had a cough and I've had a sore throat for the past two days and I was just worried that I might have COVID so I thought I'd come in. Just to make sure that everything's OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, well that's a good idea that you came in, so it's been happening for the last two days. Did you start having the cough first or the sore throat or both around the same time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It started with a sore throat two nights ago and then it got worse in the morning when I woke up and then I developed the cough, like about a day ago, a day and a half.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and can you describe your cough? Is it a wet cough or a dry cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you having any kind of? Are you bringing up any blood or sputum at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. And, uh. So this started 2 days ago. Is it constant, are your symptoms constant? Or they come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, they're not constant. They kind of come and go.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do they occur when you're exerting yourself at all or it can happen it? Or do they happen at some point during the day in the morning or night, or just randomly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's pretty random.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Are you symptom getting any better or worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? Maybe a little worse. I kind of feel like I'm also, um, I'm now having like a, a runny nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: A runny nose as well? OK, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, maybe like I don't know just now even, like an hour or two ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm have you had any recent exposure to anyone that's been sick recently at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? Maybe. I, I work at a hospital. Um, but I'm always maintaining, social distancing and I try to be very careful.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh. Do you have you tried any medications over the counter to help with these symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any other symptoms like. Shortness of breath, chest pain, dizziness, or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Okay. And the sore throat are you having trouble or pain while swallowing any food?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's not that bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Not that bad.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's just irritation in my throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any hoarseness in your voice at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Well, OK. Have you traveled at all recently utside of the province?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any nausea, vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Now I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. Any fatigue or malaise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe a little bit. It's not too bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any muscle aches at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? Yeah, little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe two days ago?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it just all over your body or in certain locations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's all over.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you tried any pain medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm no, no I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any changes in your bowel movement at all like Constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, any changes in your appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you lost any significant weight recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any past medical conditions that you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I'm pretty healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any allergies to medication?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any environmental allergy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any previous, so sorry? Are you taking any medications at all right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? Um, I'm not, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any past hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK, and any family history of any lung or heart condition.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just high blood pressure. My mom has it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and currently, are you working?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was working before the symptoms started.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what do you do for work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I work as a custodian at the hospital.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so you've been isolating and have you gotten COVID swab test yet?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm no I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so yeah we can do that for you today after a physical, physical examination.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Currently, right now, what's your living situation like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live alone.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you live in like an apartment or house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Apartment.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any new exposures at all in your house to dust, new, carpets, animals, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I used to, I don't anymore. I I smoked when I was in high school. Maybe a couple times.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, once once a day, maybe one class of wine at night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so that's all the questions I had for you today. Do you have any questions or concerns?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so yeah, it seems like you've been having these symptoms for the last few days. They seem kind of like viral in nature with your dry cough and runny nose, sore throat. And sometimes with these viral illnesses, it may take some time for the symptoms to go away, especially the cough. So today we will do a COVID swab test for you today, as a lot of the symptoms overlap and you will receive the result in the next one to two days and be contacted by public health for further instructions. As for management, I think you can take over the counter medications like Tylenol cold, drink lots of fluids and stay hydrated. And if those if your symptoms worsen at all, you can contact us again.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
